014package org.jdbi.v3.core.enums.internal;
015
016import java.lang.reflect.Type;
017import java.util.Optional;
018
019import org.jdbi.v3.core.array.SqlArrayType;
020import org.jdbi.v3.core.array.SqlArrayTypeFactory;
021import org.jdbi.v3.core.config.ConfigRegistry;
022import org.jdbi.v3.core.enums.EnumStrategy;
023import org.jdbi.v3.core.generic.GenericTypes;
024import org.jdbi.v3.core.internal.EnumStrategies;
025import org.jdbi.v3.core.qualifier.QualifiedType;
026
027// TODO Make this a QualifiedSqlArrayTypeFactory after we add qualified SQL array support
028public class EnumSqlArrayTypeFactory implements SqlArrayTypeFactory {
029    @Override
030    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
031    public Optional<SqlArrayType<?>> build(Type elementType, ConfigRegistry config) {
032        return Optional.of(elementType)
033            .map(GenericTypes::getErasedType)
034            .filter(Enum.class::isAssignableFrom)
035            .map(clazz -> makeSqlArrayType((Class<Enum>) clazz, config));
036    }
037
038    private <E extends Enum<E>> SqlArrayType<E> makeSqlArrayType(Class<E> enumClass, ConfigRegistry config) {
039        boolean byName = EnumStrategy.BY_NAME == config.get(EnumStrategies.class).findStrategy(QualifiedType.of(enumClass));
040
041        return byName
042            ? SqlArrayType.of("varchar", Enum::name)
043            : SqlArrayType.of("integer", Enum::ordinal);
044    }
045}
